taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section tholiformes;species boyntoni;

treatment.description: Similar to no. 77, more arching, with some ascending and other trailing and rooting branches; primocanes sparsely glandular, remotely prickly; leaves velvety-pubescent beneath; primocane-leaves 5-foliolate, the terminal broadly cordate-ovate finely double-serrate acuminate leaflet about 1 dm. long and on a petiolule 3.5-4 cm. long; inflorescence racemose or subcorymbose, leafy-bracted at base, with copiously glandular and often prickly ascending pedicels 2-5 cm. long; calyx glandular-hispid, its lobes reflexed in fruit; petals very large; fruit elongate.
